page.title: 20Railway Property Reborn
page.content: Railway lines from Louth inland to Bardney closed in the early 1950's, the ones to Mablethorpe on the coast in the late 1950's.The main line to Grimsby closed in 1970,the track being taken up in the early 1980's to be used in the new Selby coalfield. Builders want to demolish the last remaining bridge to make room for houses but some local people feel it ought to be preserved.The Louth to Grimsby line has been bought by the Railway Preservation Society,as has the Louth signal box.The station building and surrounding substantial property have been considered for many development projects.1985 has seen it designated an industrial/commercial development called Louth Station Estates.The station is a listed building and will hopefully be tastefully conserved.
